10.7.18  5:46 pm   i'm confused about songs that have that little half-step passing chord thingy (i know, i know, use your ears.. but this thing always confuses me and I hear it a lot, and I'm sure it's a really simple concept)... like that bruno mars finesse song with the C# to C7 to Fmin (i think), would that be in Fmin and the C# is a sharp 5? if somebody put those chords in front of you and told you to take a solo, what might you play over that C# chord?

10.7.18  4:53 pm   Do you have any suggestions for singing vocal runs so well? Yours are articulate but also light and easy sounding. I love the feel, I can almost feel my voice doing them when I hear them ha:) I've been singing for a few years and have gotten to the point where sometimes they roll out naturally but at other times there's a little wobble in either the tone or one/some of the notes. Usually if I have been singing for an hour + everything sounds and feels better, but that seems to be such a long time to get into the groove. Thoughts?

10.7.18  5:13 am   I currently very much dislike pop music but I want to be more tolerant. As somebody who appreciates pop, can you tell me how I can change my dismissive view on it?

      What do you personally like about it?

      I don't want to sound like a snob or elitist, I actually want my mind changed. Pop music is everywhere and I don't want to feel so negatively about it. I want to understand why people like it so I can find my peace with it and maybe start to appreciate it myself.

10.6.18  10:51 pm   I have listened to your content on YouTube and your music for 8 weeks straight and have no regrets about any of it. I have studied just a touch of what you have accomplished in 18 years and it's seems frightening to some, yet spellbinding to many.

You are an award-winning cartoonist, author of many haikus in the reality and expert column, web designer, clothing designer, songwriter, actor, writer, director, producer, colorful music and history teacher, colorful lighthearted preacher, and bringing life into the music business that no other musician ever has and have opened many eyes to infinite possibilities in this generation.

My point is, what is the next step for you now, besides the music? Will you be passionate for a cause like diabetes or sickle cell anemia create a cause for those who are less fortunate in the place of music such as music for the disabled orchestra, or continue on this road until something suddenly come s up?&nb sp;
